an6.6:4.1: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with six factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
an6.6:4.3: It’s when a fine royal thoroughbred can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches. And it’s strong.
an6.6:4.4: A fine royal thoroughbred with these six factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
an6.6:5.1: In the same way, a mendicant with these six factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, worthy of veneration with folded palms, and is a supreme field of merit for the world.
an6.6:5.4: It’s when mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and phenomena.
